meta.description: Educational content for Government Retirement Schemes (EPF, NPS, PPF) focusing on hidden clauses, tax traps, and optimization.

epf_knowledge.title: EPF (Employees' Provident Fund): The Hidden Rules

salary_decoder.name: The 'Pension' Diversion
salary_decoder.rule: 12% Employer Share is NOT fully EPF
salary_decoder.insight: Out of your employer's 12% share, 8.33% goes to the Pension Scheme (EPS) (capped at ₹1,250/mo) and only 3.67% goes to your EPF corpus.
salary_decoder.action: Don't calculate 24% of Basic as your EPF corpus. It's actually ~15.67% + Fixed Pension.

salary_decoder.name: VPF (Voluntary Provident Fund)
salary_decoder.insight: You can ask HR to deduct more than 12% from your salary. This extra amount (VPF) earns the same high government interest rate.
salary_decoder.action: Highly recommended for safe debt allocation. Better than FD.

tax_traps.name: The 5-Year Service Rule
tax_traps.explanation: If you withdraw EPF before completing 5 years of *continuous* service, the entire amount becomes taxable, and previously claimed 80C deductions are reversed.
tax_traps.recommendation: Never withdraw during job switches. Always 'Transfer' your EPF to the new employer to keep the 5-year counter running.

tax_traps.name: Interest Tax on High Contribution
tax_traps.explanation: If your total EPF+VPF contribution exceeds ₹2.5 Lakh in a year, the interest earned on the *excess* amount is taxable.
tax_traps.recommendation: Monitor your VPF contributions to stay tax-efficient.

process_checks.note: Ensure all previous company PF accounts are merged into your current UAN. Unmerged accounts stop earning interest after 3 years of inactivity.
Check if your previous employer marked 'Date of Exit' in the EPF portal. You cannot transfer funds without this.

optimization_hacks.name: The '5th of the Month' Rule
optimization_hacks.insight: Interest is calculated on the lowest balance between the 5th and the last day of the month. If you deposit on the 6th, you lose interest for the whole month.
optimization_hacks.action: Set your SIP/Standing Instruction for the 1st or 2nd of every month.

optimization_hacks.name: Maturity Extension Block
optimization_hacks.insight: After 15 years, you can extend PPF by 5 years *with* or *without* fresh contributions. This keeps your corpus earning tax-free interest.
optimization_hacks.action: Submit Form H within 1 year of maturity to extend with contributions.

liquidity_decoder.name: Loan Against PPF
liquidity_decoder.insight: You can take a loan at just +1% interest rate against your PPF balance. Extremely cheap credit.
liquidity_decoder.action: Use this for emergencies instead of a Personal Loan.

liquidity_decoder.name: Partial Withdrawal
liquidity_decoder.insight: You can withdraw 50% of the balance after completing 6 financial years.
liquidity_decoder.action: Tax-free withdrawal. Good for child education milestones.

nps_knowledge.title: NPS (National Pension System): The Fine Print

fee_decoder.name: POP Charges (Point of Presence)
fee_decoder.insight: Banks charge a small fee (0.10% or min ₹10-20) every time you invest. Doing it directly via eNPS saves some commission.
fee_decoder.action: Invest via eNPS (CRA) directly to minimize transaction costs.

fee_decoder.name: The Annuity Lock (The 40% Rule)
fee_decoder.insight: At age 60, you CANNOT withdraw 100% money. You must buy an Annuity (Pension Plan) for at least 40% of the corpus. The pension you receive is **Taxable**.
fee_decoder.action: Factor this taxation into your retirement planning. NPS is not fully tax-free like PPF.

smart_choices.name: Auto vs Active Choice
smart_choices.reason: Auto choice reduces equity exposure conservatively as you age. 'Active Choice' lets you keep Equity at 75% until age 60 for max growth.
smart_choices.action: Review your asset allocation. If you are young (<45), verify you aren't stuck in a low-equity Auto tier.

smart_choices.name: Tier 2 Account
smart_choices.insight: It works like a low-cost Mutual Fund with no lock-in. You can withdraw anytime.
smart_choices.action: Good for parking surplus money if you want low management fees, but NO tax benefits here.

checklist.note: Crucial. Unclaimed PF/Pension money is huge in India. Ensure nominees are current (e.g., update after marriage).
For EPF, filing e-Nomination online is mandatory to view your passbook or file claims.
